message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM. 

The paper discusses the development of a web application that recommends related TED lecture videos to users based on the content of the videos from the transcripts. This involves constructing a network for recommending videos that are similar content-wise and providing a user interface. The use of speech transcripts suggests a focus on natural language processing (NLP), which is a subfield of computer science that deals with the interaction between computers and human language. Therefore, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the use of machine learning techniques to analyze the content of the videos and recommend related ones suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (AI), which makes cs.AI a likely sub-category. The use of a user interface also suggests a focus on human-computer interaction (HCI), which makes cs.LG (Learning) a likely sub-category. Finally, the fact that the videos are related to lectures suggests a focus on multimedia (MM), which makes cs.MM a possible sub-category.
